revised_title: Effects of Hypophysectomy on Cats: A Study on Reproductive and General Health
tldr: The authors conducted a study on the effects of hypophysectomy on cats, focusing on their reproductive and general health. They performed the surgery on 25 cats and observed changes in body weight, temperature, hair loss, and sensitivity to insulin. The results showed that hypophysectomized cats experienced a decrease in body weight, slightly lower body temperature, loss of hair, and hypersensitivity to insulin. This study contributes to the understanding of the role of the pituitary gland in the overall health of cats.
